page.title: 14GAMES CHILDREN PLAY (a)
page.content: In Pleasley many children play the game 'Runacross'.This is a game that can be played by a large number of children, the more people playing the more exciting and enjoyable is the game. It is mainly played in the school playground because two large semi circles are needed. One person has to be 'On', the person for this role is picked by doing a 'Dip'. A Dip is when all the players stand together and a song is sung. e.g. 'Ip dip your not it!'When you arrive at the last person he or she is 'On'. The person who is 'On' stands in the middle of the two semi circles, the other children then try to run from one circle to the next without the person who is 'On' touching or 'tigging' them as the children say. If a person is 'tug' they are then 'On' and take the place of the person who was 'On'.
